Drain the water and grind the soaked dal mixture into a smooth batter using a blender or grinder.
Add 1/2 cup of thick poha to the batter and blend until well combined.
Cover and let the batter ferment in a warm place for 12-15 hours or overnight.
Once fermented, add salt to taste and mix well.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and grease it with a small amount of butter.
Using a ladle, pour a small amount of the fermented batter onto the pan and spread it evenly to form a thick circle.
Place 1-2 diced tomatoes in the center of the uttapam and sprinkle a pinch of salt.
Cover the pan with a lid and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the edges start to curl and the surface is dry.
Loosen the uttapam with a spatula and flip it over to cook for another 1-2 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve the uttapam hot with butter on top and your choice of chutney or sambar.

name: Vada
ingredients: Urad dal, ginger, curry leaves, green chilies, black pepper
instructions:
Rinse 1 cup of urad dal and soak it in water for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Drain the water and grind the soaked urad dal into a smooth paste using a grinder or blender.
Add 1-inch piece of grated ginger, 2-3 curry leaves, 1-2 green chilies, and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper to the ground urad dal paste.
Mix well until all the ingredients are well combined and the paste is smooth.
Cover and let the mixture ferment in a warm place for 1-2 hours or until it becomes light and frothy.
Once fermented, mix the batter well and add water if necessary to achieve a thick but pourable consistency.
Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.
Using a ladle, pour small amounts of the batter into the hot oil and shape into round vadas.
Fry the vadas until they are golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes on each side.
Remove the fried vadas from the oil and drain on paper towels.
Serve the vadas hot with your favorite chutney or sambar.

name: Veg Kolhapuri
ingredients: Gobi, potato, beans, khus khus, coconut
instructions:
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
Add 1 small onion, finely chopped, and sauté until it turns translucent.
Add 2 cloves of garlic, minced, and sauté for another minute.
Add 1 medium-sized potato, peeled and diced, and sauté for 3-4 minutes or until it starts to brown.
Add 1 cup of mixed vegetables, including gobi and beans, and sauté for 5 minutes or until they are half-cooked.
Add 1 teaspoon of khus khus paste and sauté for another minute.
Add 1 cup of coconut milk and 1 cup of water, and stir well to combine.
Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 10-12 minutes or until the vegetables are fully cooked.
Season with salt to taste, then garnish with chopped fresh cilantro and serve hot.

name: Vegetable jalfrezi
ingredients: Baby corn, french beans, garam masala, ginger, carrot
instructions:
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add 1-inch piece of grated ginger and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add 1 cup of sliced carrots and sauté for 3-4 minutes until they start to soften.
Add 1 cup of sliced french beans and sauté for another 3-4 minutes until they are tender-crisp.
Add 1 cup of baby corn and sauté for 2-3 minutes until they are coated with the spice mixture.
Add 1 teaspoon of garam masala powder and mix well.
Stir-fry everything together for another minute to combine all the flavors.
Season with salt to taste, then remove from heat and serve hot.

name: Vindaloo
ingredients: Chicken, coconut oil, wine vinegar, ginger, green, cinnamon
instructions:
Heat 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add 1-inch piece of grated ginger and sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add 1 pound of boneless, skinless chicken breast or thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces, and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-6 minutes.
Add 2 tablespoons of wine vinegar and stir to deglaze the pan, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom.
Add 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon and stir to combine with the chicken and ginger mixture.
Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, covered, for 10-12 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Stir in 1/4 cup of chopped fresh green chilies and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Serve the vindaloo hot, garnished with additional green chilies if desired.

name: Zunka
ingredients: Gram flour, mustard, garlic, turmeric, red chilli
instructions:
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add 1 teaspoon of mustard seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
Add 2-3 cloves of minced garlic and sauté until they turn light brown.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder and sauté for another second.
Add 1/2 teaspoon of red chilli powder and sauté for another second.
Gradually add 2 tablespoons of gram flour, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Cook the mixture for about 5 minutes, stirring frequently, until it turns light brown and has a nutty aroma.
Remove the pan from heat and let the zunka cool slightly.
Serve the zunka hot with rice, roti, or as a side dish.
